text:
Sawaddee ka welcome to hot Thai kitchen today I'm 
going to show you a dish called miang pla too now

whenever you hear the word Miang in front of a dish 
name it means that it's some sort of a bite-size

wrap and there's lots of different types of Miang 
out there in Thai cuisine but the one I'm going

to show you today is my absolute favorite and it's 
probably the easiest one you can make two really

really healthy really delicious let's get started 
so one of the main components of this dish is rice

noodles or what we call kanom jeen and it's a 
particular kind of rice noodles that's round and

also very very tender now in Thailand it always 
comes fresh but here you can get dry ones and it's

usually sort of Vietnamese product comes in a back 
like this and they come in different sizes so the

one you want is the fine one so another type of 
noodles that you can use it's not traditional or

authentic but it works really well and sometimes 
I prefer it is the Japanese Somen noodles now

this is actually a wheat noodle and it's very very 
small very thin it cooks up to have very similar

texture as rice noodles however the problem with 
the rice noodles is that if you have left over and

you put it in the fridge and you want to eat it 
again the next day it will harden in the fridge

and so you have to reheat the noodles and let 
it cool down on all that test the Somen noodles

will live in the fridge and it will not harden 
so if you want to have it for your next meal you

don't want to bother with reheating this will be 
a better choice and once you put it in the wrap

it really you can't really tell the difference so 
it's up to you these also take a lot less times

good only takes two minutes so bring the water to 
a boil and you don't want these al dente okay rice

noodles are not good chewy you want these to cook 
fully and so they become tender in the end so for

this size I find about nine minutes so the noodles 
are done and now what you need to do with these

rice noodles is put them in the pot a bowl of cold 
water and that'll cool them down and as you can

see there's so much star that's what you want to 
wash off by putting it in cold water so that then

the noodles are not gumming up together now you 
don't want to just drain it and leave the noodles

sitting in a clump because what's going to happen 
is they'll be really hard for people to separate

it'll just be this massive noodles right so what 
we do in Thailand is we take them out and we

arrange them into sort of bite-sized portions okay 
so what you do is you take just a little bit give

it a shake so it releases all the tangles okay and 
you always get more than you think you're going to

get and then what I do is I just rest it fresh 
for a little bit on the paper towel to absorb

excess water and then you coil it up and so that 
way when people go to grab it they're not having

to pull it out of a big massive noodle so it's one 
neat little piece all right let's make the sauce

as I mentioned this Ming is Ming flat who now 
Platt who is a Thai short mackerel so this being

seafood the sauce we're using is quite similar to 
my ultimate seafood sauce some of you may remember

that video it's just a little bit different okay 
we're gonna start out with some garlic and chilies

so in goes to the blender and then I'm going to 
add some palm sugar however this palm sugar I

actually soaked it a little bit in hot water and 
it's just to help the sugar dissolve some fish

sauce of course and fresh lime juice I'm going 
to add a whole bunch of cilantro I want to make

sure though that you use the stems and the leaves 
I see sometimes people pick off all the leaves of

the cilantro and then throw the stems away and I'm 
always like no okay now I'm going to blend this up

all right that looks good and that's it almost 
done is one more thing to do is dealing with our

plateau so this is splat - ladies and gentlemen 
Thai short mackerel if you can't find the short

macro you can also just get regular mackerel 
widely available and I get mine in fillet form

frozen and this is going to be a little bit fatty 
er which may not be a bad thing but the flavor of

these two are very similar especially once you 
put it in the wrap it's really sort of the same

feeling you're getting from either so now I'm 
going to pan fry now if you get flat whoo they

always come already steamed and I'm just gonna 
pan sear them to get the skin golden brown and

to heat up the meat basically this macro the 
regular one is raw so I have to cook it but it

only takes maybe like one and a half minutes on 
each side it's very quick and that's it so now

one thing I'm going to tell you about mackerel is 
that there are pin bones ooh now you can either

just tell your guests hey watch for bones or 
you're serving children or you don't you're

responsible for anyone joking you can pull them 
out now it's hard to pull them out when it's raw

because it's the key but once it's cooked you can 
just run your finger and you can feel it and just

pull them out and they're just right here and 
you can feel it and that's it all right this

is my favorite part building the platter so this 
is a DIY kind of wrap okay so you build your own

as you eat so it's a great opportunity to get a 
really nice platter out for your guests so I've

got here some bamboo basket that I got from like 
a Japanese dollar store for literally two dollars

some banana leaves which is available at Asian 
grocery stores in the frozen section make sure

you clean these they're super dirty when you 
buy them and then I just got some green leaf

lettuce which is classic for this Ming but you 
can use other kinds of lettuce too but stick

with something crunchy right so here's our sauce 
the other ingredients for the wrap that I haven't

talked about so this is shredded ginger goes so 
well together some shallots some roasted peanuts

and I always roast mine fresh I always buy them 
raw because if you buy them roasted they've been

roasted for a long time and they're just not they 
don't have as fresh of a flavor right and you just

stick them in the oven for 15-20 minutes that's 
it's super easy take the noodles which are now

in easy to move bundles and just pile on a few and 
they'll dry up and become a little bit sticky as

they sit okay and now the fish goes on and that's 
it look how pretty that is okay but I will tell

you this that dipping sauce is spicy so if you are 
serving to a bunch of people and some people like

it spicy some not what I would recommend is don't 
make this spicy maybe you only use one chili and

then just add a little dish of fresh chilies to 
the size so the people who like it spicy can sort

and you will chop this obviously don't just keep 
them whole chop it up so people can add little

pieces of fresh chilies to their own bite that's 
one way to get around it as well but yeah I might

as well just put a couple down just for garnish 
in my case there you go all right let me show you

how to eat this you just take a fork and it comes 
out pretty easily so make sure you watch for bones

okay because you know dealing with a whole fish 
and with but with lots of little bones involved

if you're serving this to kids definitely do this 
for them or what you can do what I do sometimes is

I just take them out into little chunks like this 
and I don't serve the whole fish I just serve a

plate with little chunks and I've gone through 
them make sure there are no bones in advance a

little piece of lettuce a little piece of fish 
a little bundle of rice noodles please probably

a little a little much for one bite so I'm going 
to just pull it apart a little bit some ginger I

love ginger with this I'm gonna load it up a bit 
some shallots some peanuts and then some sauce

this looks like a big bite but it's one bite oh 
oh oh that is so good it's so refreshing this

there's just so much going on the crunchiness 
the gin during is the nuttiness the tender

noodles and a little bit chewy fish and that 
sauce spicy let me warn you spicy garlicky but

super refreshing oh this is so good oh my god 
you have to try it now one thing I'll tell you

you notice I didn't season my fish at all when I 
fried them macro has a lot of natural saltiness

already so trust me with this sauce especially 
you're not going to need any seasoning this is

so good alright I'm super hungry so I'm gonna 
go and devour the rest of this the recipe as

always will be on hot Thai Kitchen calm when you

if you haven't subscribed to the show please
